text: So what will module 2's index look like? Well, in part 5 we're going to start off talking about time, price and volume as key identifier. We'll then move on to initiative and responsive price pattern behaviour. Then symmetrical vs non-symmetrical profiles, the initial balance, volume profiling day types being trend and non-trend, and finish part 5 with the trading process with volume In part 6 we'll talk about bracketing vs trending, volume and volatility, the market's opening in and out of balance, pre-open routine of a trader and trade location. Then in part 7 we're going to move on to daytime auctions, market auction excess, volume pointer controls, auction control variables and finish with high volume errors In part 8 we'll finish with key control identifiers, distinct profile pattern strategies, volume profile templating and deliberate practice.
